body: You can probably attach a debugger to the processes and print the stack trace.
Thank you @zcbenz will get the stack trace.

Hello @zcbenz, i was able to attach to electron process with windbg, and got few stack traces while the freeze occured.  please do have look and let me know if that helps.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/42787852/electron-app/stack.zip

and one morething.

> https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/2409  we are getting "[nullptr](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/42787852/electron-app/stackNullPtr.txt)" while it is trying to access it.  [setDestinationOperation](https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/third_party/WebKit/Source/core/clipboard/DataTransfer.cpp?sq=package:chromium&rcl=1475493501&l=405)
> was searching for this source in chromium codes

as you said it is in blink, we tried to build electron, but chromium source code ( we could not find there ) was able to track till libchromiumcontent and unable proceed after that point. 

[ Note : Electron 1.4.1 32bit was used for debugging ]
Any inputs would be helpful.

Hello,

While debugging, while calling native notification it was throwing error, We have stopped the native notification call, so it stopped freezing the renderer. in 0.34.3 app was workign fine because there was no native notification for windows.

In few system native notification is halting the renderer.

From the stack trace the main loop is running into a COM+ message loop:

It is very likely to be related to you call native notification, and I'm sorry we can not help you on this.

Thanks for seeing it, that's okay but we are still calling native notification provided by Electron we are not calling it of our own. Is there way we can enable a switch to stop **NOTIFICATION** while starting the process so that needed application might stop them.

Current fix we have is in the particular webcontent as a patch. but may many websites will try to use "Notification" we cannot prevent them. [executeScript](http://electron.atom.io/docs/api/web-view-tag/#webviewexecutejavascriptcode-usergesture-callback) is doing that in top frame and intruding into all iFrames inside to do same. but these are all heavy patch work while loading

@kamesh-a you can use [session.setPermissionRequestHandler](https://github.com/electron/electron/blob/master/docs/api/session.md#sessetpermissionrequesthandlerhandler) to disable notification for any `webContents` in a `session`.
Awesome, Thanks for pointing it @deepak1556 I didn't see the new API's of session object. 👍
